website_summaries.verdict: The best budget drip irrigation system that offers enough nozzles and tubing for typical gardens.
pros: Long supplied tubing makes it easy to set up the drip kit in challenging or isolated spots for targeted watering
Expandable with other drip irrigation kits to supply a larger garden as needed
cons: Included instructions can be difficult to follow during the initial setup of the kit

customer_reviews.title: With a slight modification this kit is awesome. The problem is the kit does not have ...
customer_reviews.text: With a slight modification this kit is awesome. The problem is the kit does not have a 1/2 in main line. The pressure is terrible without one and had to redesign my setup. The hose connection didn't seem to work either. I went to home depot and bought a 1/2 in main line, a pressure regulator and a 1/2 in hose connection which cost me about 15 bucks all together. With the 1/2 in main line i get great pressure (too much in fact i needed a $2 regulator) . I installed this about a year ago and ever since my plants have been reaching for the sky.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew McGregor

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Pairs well with orbit timer.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great kit. I had an issue when i split the line to many times, the pressure dropped, also using non-Korman right angle fittings made the pressure drop. I love the orange spayers, i had to order additional hose and 1/4 steaks for grounding them. Make your design as simple as possible because these sprayers cover a large. Im plan to add a carbon and sediment filter to the line, will see how it maintains pressure. But excellent price, no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Grill

customer_reviews.title: Nice set-up But
customer_reviews.text: Overall nice product lots to work with,quality on par with L&H only issue but fairly important, the quick connect is threaded for 3/4 pipe not hose? Most every Timer and regulator come hose thread! Lowes has the connector FHT/MPT for a buck so no big The other issue with quick connect is the o- ring connection leaked,I rapped o- ring with tape provided (although not for this purpose ) Wala Hope this helps anyone that encounters these issues other than that Nice set-up for the money .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to replace some pvc tubing I had feeding my roses and bird bath because the pvc became brittle and broke in cold weather. (I Put of piece of the KORAM tubing in the freezer overnight to see if it would become brittle...it didn't. It just got tougher but would not break!). The pieces connect with a moderate amount of effort if you warm the end of the tubing in a cup of hot water for 15-20 seconds. I measured, layed out, and assembled my systems indoors then put them in place outside. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Patterson

customer_reviews.title: but it is easy enough to figure out how to install it
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly to set up an auto-watering system for my garden. The instructions are not very clear, but it is easy enough to figure out how to install it. The actual set up is a bit tedious and time consuming, but not due to any design flaw, its just the nature of the beast. I paired this with a timer and everything is working as it should. It has only been installed for a few months so I don't have any comments about the longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Lots of parts for fun projects. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I used only a few parts from this kit for a project I dreamed up for automatically refilling a birdbath remotely in combination with an outdoor smart plug, water tank (in this case a cooler filled with water) and a camera. Did this for my wife so she can watch birds at the lake home from 200 miles away. This kit has lots of parts for any water project you can think up and is really inexpensive for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: SYOTW

customer_reviews.title: My plants' best friend
customer_reviews.text: I'm bad at remembering to water my plants, but thanks to this system and some solenoid valves attached to a controller you'd never know it. Cutting and fitting the tubing is a piece of cake and the spray nozzles are individually adjustable so each plant gets exactly the amount of water that it needs. I installed my first system last year. It survived a brutally cold winter with zero problems despite only minimal winterizing (I detached the hose). As a result I ordered two more this year and have the whole back yard set up with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jon OBRIEN

customer_reviews.title: Working great!
customer_reviews.text: Has been in place for over two months and is working great. The only leaks were from holes that were a result of me trying to use a tool to put the hose on the tees. I've got about 50 feet with 19 nozzles and a few tees sending 6 sprayers to one side and 13 drips to another group. Very happy with it. It does come with instructions and a proper connection to your hose. Have a hose washer ready though. The clips/stands could be longer or more rigid, but that's about the only complaint. Warm hoses or not, they're tough to get on but don't leak once they're on!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tubing and connectors/emitters only work with this brand.
customer_reviews.text: Not enough hose to water a whole garden. The hose is almost self-healing, so if you’re planning on just poking holes in it to allow water to drip out, you have to poke the same holes about four times before any water consistently comes out. The tubing is more flexible than normal 1/4” drip line, so it’s great if you need it to get into small areas. The connectors and emitters ONLY work for this brand of tubing; I would suggest ordering more tubing of the same brand because you won’t find it in your local hardware/home improvement store. No problems once it was all put together though.
customer_reviews.author: Kiersten

customer_reviews.title: I have used systems such as these for many years ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used systems such as these for many years. They have worked quite well for me. This system, once installed, started popping off the emitters when the pressure came up. After quite a bit of sleuthing, I found the problem is with my water pressure. My pressure at 65 pounds/sq inch is an average high. Folks with lower pressure may have no problem with this, but if you have a higher (typical for many) pressure, you will need to install a small in line pressure reducer, which I found at my local ACE hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Johnson

customer_reviews.title: ... 2 days ago and this product is of very good quality. i put it together myself and have ...
customer_reviews.text: I received this 2 days ago and this product is of very good quality. i put it together myself and have got to say it was pretty common sense. didn't have to use instructions and your hearing this from someone who always has to read instructions. when you see the parts you can pretty much how to put two and two together. i bought this to use as a mister for a canopy on our camping trip and didn't want to pay $35-$40 on an assembled one. great quality product and when i set it up it was a really nice mist. a word of advice when putting together make sure you use gloves because you will get blisters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: *NOT* a kit. No instructions, too many unwanted pieces. Still, works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a kit. Not "every thing you will need." This is an assortment of accessory parts to expand a kit. Read the description carefully. I did not. There are not any instructions, and way too many bits you won't be using. However, by purchasing some larger tubing (7/8), which fits nicely into the clever, adaptable hose bib, I was able to make it a kit, though I paid for a lot of pieces I don't need. Everything is well-made and works well with the exception of the spikes, which bend rather than penetrating firm soil.. The hose bib *does* fit US faucets, despite previous reviews. Maybe they changed the part. Overall, I'm happy, as are my plants.
customer_reviews.author: CiscoD

customer_reviews.title: A good product made perfect by some cheap zip ties
customer_reviews.text: A good product made perfect by some cheap zip ties. In the Houston summer, I'm finding that the water pressure when the system first starts up is enough to make some of the connections pop out, due to the heat. If you live in an area that gets exceptionally hot I recommend buying some small zip ties along with this so that they all stay together, probably not an issue in colder climates. Overall, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Just setup the system. It works great. The orange capped nozzles have a wide range from slow drip to dispersed mist. I found the red capped nozzles to not be needed. They spray small streams in all directions. This system is great for my raised bed/cold frame setup. I have plenty of pieces and hose left over after doing about a 12' x 2' area. I did run out of stakes, but those are cheap from any local hardware store and I over-staked as it is. Overall, this is a great product. If anything changes over the season, I'll submit a follow-up review.
customer_reviews.author: Kristopher

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not waste your money. The tubing that comes with this kit is garbage. Any significant pressure blows the very "slick" tubing off of the fitting. I set-up this micro-sprinkler kit for my raised bed garden before we left on vacation and came back to a dead garden and water shooting across the back yard from the tubing that slid off the "T". Even the fittings are not great. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Logan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t allow enough water flow
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just don’t know what I’m doing, but this is the fourth configuration I came up with and it STILL won’t keep pressure through to the end of my line! The end two nozzles literally drip. First two are amazing! Middles ones are so-so. But by the end it is dripping. My water is on full blast. Plenty of pressure. Nothing on the front end is dripping. I would NOT recommend this. That line is only about 20 ft.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Great kit!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome kit - the hose is good quality that is very flexible. All the pieces worked. Heads up - the orange sprayer/misters can be finicky but I got them all to work correctly by taking them apart, switching heads, or just working with them a bit. So if they do not mist perfect, try running them all the way up and down their range while they are on and if that does not work - then poke or switch heads. The held up great in the garden. I recommend using a bigger line that the 1/4" out of the nozzle.
customer_reviews.author: M rux

customer_reviews.title: Going with the 1/2” line makes half of this package useless so you are better off buying the items separately
customer_reviews.text: This package is not everything you would need for a successful irrigation system. The 1/4” line that comes with the package does not supply enough water pressure/volume to support the sprayers. Save yourself time/money by buying 1/2” main line and tap into it with the 1/4” tubing for each sprayer using a coupling. Going with the 1/2” line makes half of this package useless so you are better off buying the items separately. Had a few sprayers crack while assembling them.
customer_reviews.author: Laken Thomas

customer_reviews.title: great addition to irrigation system
customer_reviews.text: good kit. i used every piece. i needed more tees for my garden, so i got another kit from my local homedepot for about 20 bucks. it was a rainbird kit. came in a bucket. wasnt as good as this kit tho, but it came with more tees, tubing, and other junk. what i like most about the koram watering kit are probably the orange mister heads. the red ones arent too bad either. gets alot of water coverage. it takes a while to assemble depending on how many plants you gotta water.
customer_reviews.author: harlow

customer_reviews.title: Needs a little tweak, but great.
customer_reviews.text: We will see how they hold up, but initially these are great. I'm curious to see if they survive a freeze... I too had problems with pressure. If you turn off the bottom sprayer and turn the top on to mist, plenty of pressure to power all the heads. Ditch the sprinkle and stick to mist and you're gold.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mooney

customer_reviews.title: ready to install
customer_reviews.text: this is a great kit, it has everything you need. at least for my occasion. definitely worth the money! if I end up doing the other side of my house as well I will definitely will be buying this kit again!!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: No pressure at all
customer_reviews.text: Hoping this would be a great alternative to the expensive rainbirds. But all I get on any of the connectors are drips. Yes, my pressure is great and I have a regulator as well. I had to use my old rainbird ones to finish the job. So The only thing I used was the stoppers and the tube which is soft so hard to connect the nozzles.
customer_reviews.author: Blinkit Photography

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set as an addition to the larger set because none of the orange nozzles worked in the other set, so I needed more nozzles. This system works great for my small vegetable plot. I use it on a 50 gallon rain barrel and there is plenty of pressure to reach the whole bed. Its super easy to set up and to configure in any which way you want. My only complaint is that you can’t buy the components separately...so now I have 50,000 feet of tubing and still don’t have enough nozzles.
customer_reviews.author: Renee B.

customer_reviews.title: These kits are great and they work for everything in your gardend
customer_reviews.text: These kits are great and they work for everything in your gardend. I especially love how these stay iin place and spray water at a rate adjusted. I finally have a green thumb. This is the vest value on Amazon for watering gardens, flower beds, etc.!
customer_reviews.author: jumper

customer_reviews.title: Installed in less than 30 minutes
customer_reviews.text: My husband wanted this for our newly designed and planted front garden. He installed it within 30 minutes or less and he said it was really easy. He's a carpenter, so I'm not sure that has anything to do with it, but he seemed pretty happy with the result. It hides well under the mulch and our plants are alive and well after little rain the past two weeks this summer. So 5 stars for this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Casi_Girl

customer_reviews.title: not bad the instructions say theres supposed to be additional parts
customer_reviews.text: not bad the instructions say theres supposed to be additional parts. It says it can handle 19 attachments i got 6 on and get almost no pressure with all of the attachments open. Connecting the 1⁄4 in tube to a 1⁄2 in tube will probably increase the pressure at the attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: a very good starter kit I do recommend getting a good pair of scissors to cut the line segments that you need I tried it on my potted plants outside didn't work out in the long term for me but very good product so I would definitely recommend this for anyone wanting to try drip irrigation and you can just look at your set up and be able to put together something to fit your needs with little headache or frustration.
customer_reviews.author: killking110

customer_reviews.title: Not a "complete kit."
customer_reviews.text: The description on Amazon for this item is mostly accurate but far from complete. In order to use this collection of parts, you need to buy a 1/2 inch diameter distribution line - at a minimum. You may need other parts as well. Without additional parts, you can't effectively use this so-called "kit." This fact should be included in the Amazon product description. This is not a "complete kit."
customer_reviews.author: Tahoe

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a set of nearly everything you need for a decent-size garden. The hose is brown, not black (matters in Texas summer). It's easy to install because it's very soft and takes shapes easily. Adding on is also simple. I ended up going to Home Depot to buy 'sprinkler' units to add to it, but then I have since enlarged the system to cover my entire back yard, too.
customer_reviews.author: Carolle

customer_reviews.title: There’s no water pressure. Water only comes out the ...
customer_reviews.text: There’s no water pressure. Water only comes out the first 5 drips and the rest barely any water comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar

customer_reviews.title: 1/4" tubing doesn't provide enough pressure.
customer_reviews.text: All the different connections and nozzles are a great setup, but the 1/4" tubing is just too small. Trying to run this roughly 15 feet with only 6 of the red nozzles resulted in the 6th nozzle not receiving any water. I've since bought a 1/2" kit with different sprayer nozzles, but I'll probably add in a few of these nozzles to get a better spread of watering. On the plus side the quick connect nozzle was great, did not leak, fit really well into the PVC outlet I made for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Although all the parts were there I had to go ...
customer_reviews.text: Although all the parts were there I had to go looking online for instructions on how to set them up. DO NOT turn the water on full blast it will over tax the tubing since they are just push on and not clamped down
customer_reviews.author: Ken Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great easy starter kit to hookup
customer_reviews.text: Great set. I never realized drip irrigation was so easy to setup. I thought it would take hours. I setup 3-4 different beds in less than one hour. The sprayers are adjustable to heavy spray or drip
customer_reviews.author: Derek Allen

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I put in a rather long run for ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to say first that this DID come with the garden hose connection and screwed together leak free. So far so good. I put in a rather long run for a hedge we're trying to get established and I'm hoping gravity will be our friend. I used my electric lawn edger to make trenches between the plants an buried the connecting runs so I'm very hopeful that there are no leaks! Went together quickly.
customer_reviews.author: jay plain

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable selection of pieces, but misleading
customer_reviews.text: We have super high water pressure, but your actually limited to using about 3 or 4 emitters out of the entire kit. The kit is by no means an indication that all the parts could be used in a single application. Practically speaking, in order to use the entire kit, you would have to run 1/2" PVC from the water source to where you need it, then feed very short pieces of tubing to the emitters.
customer_reviews.author: Robert145

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK! DOESNT WORK WELL AT ALL!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, cheaply made and poorly thought out system. Many of the irrigation heads did not work right out of the box or were broken. By the time you are about 20 feet down the pipe you lose all pressure and the system becomes useless. Cant believe I wasted money on this. Find another company.
customer_reviews.author: Gstel

customer_reviews.title: The connectors are nice, but it doesn't work at all
customer_reviews.text: It is stated that it works with NO PRESSURE. I tried hooking it to my Rain Barrel. It simply doesn't work. The connectors are nice, but it doesn't work at all. Then I noticed on the bottom of the package that it says must have at least 25 psi. So to me, it is false advertising. I would have never purchased it if I had know that prior. It is too bad it didn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Board

customer_reviews.title: Would be good for watering plants
customer_reviews.text: Would be good for watering plants. My intended use was as a spray mister for sitting on the deck. The water output is way too high, went through more than a gallon of water in less than five minutes. That wouldn't be bad if the mist was more of a mist than simply a fine spray. Nozzels are not adjustable although the description said they were. It was worth the try, and on a really hot day, it will still do well enough.
customer_reviews.author: AM PhotoTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging and Instructions Numerous parts were missing
customer_reviews.text: Poor packaging and Instructions Numerous parts were missing. There was no parts list which identified each part. The instructions were in such a tiny font - hard to read. No support phone number or website provided - I googled it on my own and found instructions on youtube. If you are ordering the kit for the first time, and you are a DIY'er for the drip irrigation for the first time, then Good luck! You are on your own!!!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good for some applications
customer_reviews.text: So I really like the idea behind this product and think it would work really well in some applications. The problem I ran in to Was that when the sunlight started to hit the plastic directly over time, it would become soft and the sprayer heads would fall out. This became very problematic Having the sprinkler system on a timer. It would go unnoticed for a little while. The other issue that I ran into was that if you put too many heads on to the line, there will not be enough pressure with that small of tubing to allow water to get to the end
customer_reviews.author: Dave Knause

customer_reviews.title: This is a good priced package since you have lots of items in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good priced package since you have lots of items in it. Used it to put drippers in the front and back yard. The plugs that go to the main distribution line are a bit fat so it is causing water loss. I had to buy the thinner type from Lowe's. The spray ends however are fantastic since you can fine tune the amount of water..much better than the fixed 1gph drip ends you get from Lowe's.
customer_reviews.author: Drake Forte

customer_reviews.title: Does not connect to any hose
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if anyone else has had a great experience with this product, but the nozzle doesn't fit onto any connection that I own, nor that I can get my hands on. It's advertised as "sold with" the "Orbit 62061N-91213 Single-Dial Water Timer" but does not connect to it at all. The product may work great, but I'm done messing around with it and sending it in for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Tesseva

customer_reviews.title: Avoid
customer_reviews.text: Avoid. I checked all connections before i left thurs am. Come back sun pm and everything is dead. Cheap line seperated from a connection. I lost all my plants
customer_reviews.author: Lexicon Devil

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, easy setup, great price. Had zero issues plumbing my 6x10 greenhouse in under an hour. Plenty of nozzles with this kit which allowed me to mix and match based on my plants needs. I will certainly purchase again for future projects.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki N.

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice set, however the quality of the parts is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice set, however the quality of the parts is lacking. The tube, is very problematic as it comes off very easily. The railbird tubing I bought does not come off the water connector at all, but at least a couple times a week I have to go an re attach this tubing. I will need to replace all of it..
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Broken after first use
customer_reviews.text: worked great until I tried to put it up for the season ... Christ everything is made out of plastic and garbage. So careful pulling the hose off the contacts or you will completely ruin the entire setup ....
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Mccurdy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and efficient !
customer_reviews.text: Great irrigation system for my greenhouse. You have to plan ahead before cutting the line. It seems like the end of the line is loosing pressure. I ordered another kit and I made a loop and that seems to work really good.
customer_reviews.author: Ioan W

customer_reviews.title: Tubing is too soft
customer_reviews.text: I have used raindrip drip irrigation products for many years but wanted to try this product because of the good price. I would not buy again. Although inserting the connectors into the tubing is very easy, because the tube is so soft, the elasticity of the tubing also allows the drippers to FREQUENTLY come off with water pressure. I even used a 15 PSI pressure reducer on the system and the drippers still shot off in hot weather. The hundreds of Raindrip drippers i have used in the past have never fallen off the Raindrip tubing. I am disappointed in this sytem.
customer_reviews.author: SLTALEE

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - it has lasted me over a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - it has lasted me over a year so far. And I bought a second set for a different location. It does save me a ton of water, and the convenience of having the plants watered without having to go out there and turn things on and off is a great time saver.
customer_reviews.author: tpp123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Save 90% water with this setup. I recommend eveyone get this for your house and you water bill will go down dramatically! don't water the whole garden and waste it. My bill dropped 40 bucks the first month and I'm not even done yet. It paid for itself already!
customer_reviews.author: AndyHouston

customer_reviews.title: this is a great misting kit
customer_reviews.text: I just bought a second one. this is a great misting kit. it is very easy to assemble. it is a bit hard to connect the nozzles but you will get the hang of it. You need to push the rubber hose onto the little unit. all in all, this is a GREAT product. the price is great. simple to use. It comes with no directions, but it easy to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Plastic weakens with a few months use and hoses pop loose!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this system was a good value, but after having it installed for a few months we started to have the hoses spring loose from the drip attachments and make a pretty big mess, as we had the system on a timer. We lowered the pressure on the system and also reinforced the hoses, only to have it occur on other ones. The overall quality of this system isn't great and its not very robust. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: E Bobby

customer_reviews.title: I am little disappointed whit the system because the last 4 or 5 ...
customer_reviews.text: I am little disappointed whit the system because the last 4 or 5 of the Dripper and the Orange Nozzle have no pressure at all ,I try my best to adjust the rest of drippers and nozzle so the water would flow evenly thru the system but with no result . I don't know if I am doing something wrong , But I think that 50 feet by 1/4 inch of tubing is to long and to narrow for the water pressure . I am thinking of split the system in 2 even parts but I would need a 1/4" Tubing Quick Connector .
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Better bargain that the Big Box stores
customer_reviews.text: This kit provided everything I needed to set up drip irrigation for 15 potted plants on my deck. It's quite a bargain compared to what is available at Lowes and Home Depot. I ended up needed more tubing but that was due to the layout of the plants on my deck. I have this set up as a zone on my sprinkler timer system and water for 30 minutes twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Jennings

customer_reviews.title: Ok mister set but I had to buy different tubing.
customer_reviews.text: I like this mister set but I do not like the black aquarium tubing they sent with both of my orders. If I don't have at least 8 misters on the tubing the water pressure causes the tuning to separate. Our patio is only 8x8 so I had to go pick up 1/4 rainbird tubing and now everything works great even with only 4 on at a time.
customer_reviews.author: ItsSaturday

customer_reviews.title: but I'd recommend splitting the line immediately near the faucet to ensure ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my tomatoes avoid the labor of watering attended. Worked well, but I'd recommend splitting the line immediately near the faucet to ensure even water distribution to each leg one creates.
customer_reviews.author: KFB

customer_reviews.title: Lines keep disconnecting from manifold
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble but the line keeps getting disconnected from the manifold. Pointless if I have to keep checking to make sure the plants are getting watered everyday.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Foster

customer_reviews.title: MIGHT be 1/4 OD its more like 3/16 ID so when I went to connect it ...
customer_reviews.text: The line isn't 1/4 ID it might, MIGHT be 1/4 OD its more like 3/16 ID so when I went to connect it to a submersible pump I had to search around for fittings to get it up to the size I need to connect the two.
customer_reviews.author: MW88Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very basic but nice.
customer_reviews.text: This kit is very basic. The spikes are only about 4" long and are thin. The tubing is thin black and reminds you of aquarium tubing. The emitter head work nice and the sprayer heads work nice but there are not many. I am having to order other drip emitter spikes to supplement the small amount that comes with this kit.
customer_reviews.author: Franhp

customer_reviews.title: Hose is awful..
customer_reviews.text: Heads and all other things are are all ok..HOSE IS AWFUL..gets too soft in the Florida heat and everyone blew apart..replaced with rainbird hose and it works great
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: A total waste of time. The rubber drip line is so cheesy that it collapses in our Arizona sunshine. The adjustable drippers won’t hold their position.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Withrow

customer_reviews.title: but this thing works awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: i was skeptical about this...but this thing works awesome!!! sure might have to custom rig the sprayers and i had to buy stakes to raise some of the sprayers, but definitely works great! pressure is good for a small garden.
customer_reviews.author: william chaple

customer_reviews.title: Not Good!
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to put together and install but when I turned the water on there was hardly any pressure coming out. I thought I had spaced out the sprinklers too close but then closed off some of the sprinklers to increase the pressure on others, the water pressure was still very low. I Would not buy again. Good thing it was only $20
customer_reviews.author: Yeng Vang

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Not much more to say than what the title says but...I will tell you...it's junk.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: not so great...
customer_reviews.text: after assembling the entire product, i was disappointed to find that if you use drip nozzles for the entire run, by the time you are at the end there is no pressure left and you barely get a dribble. i went back and swapped every head to the "atomizer" style head and it works better now. Also the hose connection stink. it blew off 3 times spewing water all over my garden. I had to fee the tubing through the larger connection, and crimp a fitting inside the housing to get the tubing to stay in place...
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas C.

customer_reviews.title: ... parts to supplement my Rainbird system and couldn't be happier. Although I ended up not using any of ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for parts to supplement my Rainbird system and couldn't be happier. Although I ended up not using any of the orange mist heads (I'm sure they have their place depending on what a customer is growing/watering), the red spray heads work excellent and I've had complements from people on them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Tubing and Nozzles
customer_reviews.text: Nice tubing and nozzles, but the stakes are very tiny - much smaller than I expected (about 4" tall). Overall, a good drip irrigation kit.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: great system and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it came with more than enough component parts and was very intuitive in assembly. Good tips were alos provided.
customer_reviews.author: P. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Which adds to the pile of unused crap to store
customer_reviews.text: Did not get the parts listed, one bag in particular of spayer heads that do not fit 1/4" hose or adaptors. The plastic stakes are difficult to keep stuck in the soil, they are too short to be effective. Which adds to the pile of unused crap to store.
customer_reviews.author: 🍄

customer_reviews.title: works good for the money
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty good for the money, various accessories add to value, line is very nice and flexible as well.
customer_reviews.author: BuyerUnknown

customer_reviews.title: An unexpensive solution to  micro-garden watering
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I think it leaves little room for better for the price. I installed a 30' long watering system in my balcony, supplied by a mini-pump from a bucket (had to take care of the hydrostatic aspect of it). Straight forward, decent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Radu

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: It got the job done. There were a few parts I didn't know how to use but for the most mart It works well. The tubing worked fine, set the cut end in a cup of hot water and you can slide the sprinkler on. The puncture part was hard to work with. I had to cut a hole in the tubing to poke the sprinkler through.
customer_reviews.author: Talitha Calamia

customer_reviews.title: Works great however, the faucet attachment is dripping
customer_reviews.text: Used this system with my water barrel for my greenhouse. Works great however, the faucet attachment is dripping, and a few of the drippers put to much water out for my liking since I use it as "slow drip"system. Otherwise I love it!!!! Has everything I need and more. Great startup system
customer_reviews.author: Ga-Bri

customer_reviews.title: Supply to Small
customer_reviews.text: I installed only five emitters on this with 65psi at hose bib. Dribble Dribble and no sprayee. The 1/4" supply tubing needs to be at least 3/8". Very bade design!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great Starter system.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter kit. Very easy to put together, I didn't heat the ends at all and they slipped right on. Pair this with a watering timer and you have your self a decent system.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme

customer_reviews.title: the flow rating on the atomizers would be nice. Also if you have any reasonable amount of ...
customer_reviews.text: the flow rating on the atomizers would be nice. Also if you have any reasonable amount of flow from your faucet, this tubing will not hold. Do not bother with it.
customer_reviews.author: Lexicon Devil

customer_reviews.title: Tubing bubbled and popped.
customer_reviews.text: The tubing bubbled then popped. We has a lot of water loss. Had to purchase new tubing and replace, did I not want another busted tubeing incedent.
customer_reviews.author: angela reyes

customer_reviews.title: Still working great, going on 2nd year
customer_reviews.text: Set this system up in the garden last year and it worked great all summer and saved us hours of time. Put it away in the winter, pulled it back out this spring, and it's still working great. Great value and pretty easy to set up watering for a medium-large sized garden in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Finchamp

customer_reviews.title: Little rain never hurt nobody.
customer_reviews.text: 18 nozzles shown. The mister nozzles are VERY effective. Easy to install and good quality. Little to no leaks. I use an ORBIT timer and have it run once a day for a two hour span with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jett F.

customer_reviews.title: perfect for hanging baskets
customer_reviews.text: strung it up to water my wifes hanging plants on our porch. Worked like a charm. plastic elbows are a little flimsy so use windex to grease them during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Collin

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: Seems good system at the beginning, easy to set up. However almost all connections have failed after month or so of use, even though not exposed to sun but tubing easily slides from plastic connectors under water pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Constantine T.

customer_reviews.title: Get bigger tubing
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, water comes out of 3 of the spouts but not the others. No instructions. Tubing is too thin to supply enough water to more than 5 spouts. No resources for troubleshooting. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works great (trick is to use a heat gun or blow ...
customer_reviews.text: works great (trick is to use a heat gun or blow dryer to heat the plastic tube to get the ends on, rubber tube is hard)
customer_reviews.author: T. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit. Used it with my dutch bucket system
customer_reviews.text: Nice kit. Used it with my dutch bucket system. Made it very easy to put together entire system without having to worry about getting any part I might of forgotten. I am currently using with a 10 bucket setup and plants are growing nicely. I would buy again if I expand my system.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Easiest drip system ever!
customer_reviews.text: These were really easy to install - and for the price they are unbeatable. I bought a simple timer from a different brand but they all work together seamlessly. These are versatile, I can change the drips into any configuration I want if I move plants or add some.
customer_reviews.author: baythedog

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I have a small garden and this has worked perfectly. It’s so customizable and easy to change. It’s also more durable than I expected. I’m going into my third season and I haven’t had any parts wear out yet!
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: A little flimsey
customer_reviews.text: Good water flow. Unfortunately the barb on the sprocket adapter is cheap and broke when I tried to remove the hose. Purchased a brass adapter for a few bucks and it works.
customer_reviews.author: M. R. Atkisson Jr.

customer_reviews.title: No more wasted time or water
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool, save water and time, have plants reach their potential, easy to assemble,fits really tight, recommend having a plan and layout. A little time consuming to assemble but worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great assortment.
customer_reviews.text: Great assortment of parts. The real downer is that the quick release is the opposite of every quick release we have. So hooking it up is going to be a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Ed willson

customer_reviews.title: Worked well.
customer_reviews.text: This set woked well to add to my existing irrigation. I'd purchase this again if I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: TruRevu

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts open bag
customer_reviews.text: Came in open bag with several missing pieces and absolutely no directions...
customer_reviews.author: Alexis

customer_reviews.title: Saving money
customer_reviews.text: I had to install this to stop a drip on my hose and now I’m saving money.
customer_reviews.author: Pipereira

customer_reviews.title: No instructions, wrong parts, rip off.
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! Home depot has a better kit for 16.99
customer_reviews.author: Robert Turner

customer_reviews.title: So so
customer_reviews.text: Using this to water my vegetable garden. It works pretty well, although the 1/4" tubing is on the small side for the number of heads provided. The last third will not put out much more than just drips. Otherwise ok.
customer_reviews.author: Woodcement

customer_reviews.title: Great Drip Watering System
customer_reviews.text: The watering system is a great value...has many parts to make all connections possible. The installation was easy and comes out without leaking and is a professional installation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: I love how easy this product was to put together and ...
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this product was to put together and setup. My water-mellons have grown a lot since the install a few weeks ago. On the down side, you can't put more than 6 or 7 of the sprinklers on or you lose too much pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Package does not include items pictured. There was no tool to punch holes AND the teflon tape was useless ... totally shredded. The items were hand packaged in baggies. I didn't use (or even open) many of the baggies but suggest you count to make sure you got the number as advertised. The tubing was at least soft and pliable.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Struck

customer_reviews.title: Everything I needed and more to set up my little ...
customer_reviews.text: Everything I needed and more to set up my little garden with personalized daily watering. You can adjust the flow to each tip to match how much water the plant needs. I added a timer to the hose setup and now it's hands free. I have only had to water my garden once in 2 months (on an excessively windy and sunny day.)
customer_reviews.author: Chappy

customer_reviews.title: This was the absolute biggest waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy his product !!! One star is one too many ! This was the absolute biggest waste of money. It does not work. An item with 30 sprayers that took hours to set up and it would not spray water after the 6th sprayer. This product does not work. Do not waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: michael d. smith

customer_reviews.title: i love this system
customer_reviews.text: i love this system. it is easy to set up and this is my second purchase. I wanted t expand my spinkler system in my green house
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine S.

product_meta.title: KORAM Irrigation Kit (IR-D G) (G)
feature_bullets: 【 SAVE WATER & MONEY 】 Provides everything you need to apply emitter tubing in garden areas and spot watering to widely spaced plants. Expand and customize your drip watering system. Save up to 70% in water savings which calculates into money in your pocket.

【 ADJUSTABLE & USEFUL 】 You can adjust freely the water flow of each nozzle head, set each plant to receive its customized watering according to its precise needs. A variety of tools allow you to DIY.
【 Suit for Beginner 】 Without any digging or plumbing skills. The kit is suitable for beginner who wants to learn home gardening, and use it to make a watering / misting / cooling system.
【 Application 】 Any place you want like swimming pool balcony cooling Plant Watering, Vegetable Garden, Lawn Misting, fog Cooling System, Dust removal, Garden humidification.
【 Install Tips 】 Put the connected part into hot water for 10 seconds before assembling. It will be easier to install and the tube will stay tight when it cools down.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars530 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
